parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.05</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Waypoints </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the currently active waypoint for a group. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> groupName '''setCurrentWaypoint''' waypoint </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> groupName: [[Object]] or [[Group]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> waypoint: [[Array]] - format [[Waypoint]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_grp [[setCurrentWaypoint]] [_grp, 1];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[waypoints]], [[deleteWaypoint]], [[copyWaypoints]], [[setWaypointBehaviour]], [[setWaypointCombatMode]], [[setWaypointCompletionRadius]], [[setWaypointDescription]], [[setWaypointFormation]], [[setWaypointHousePosition]], [[setWaypointPosition]], [[setWaypointScript]], [[setWaypointSpeed]], [[setWaypointStatements]], [[setWaypointTimeout]], [[setWaypointType]], [[setWaypointVisible]], [[waypointAttachVehicle]], [[waypointAttachedVehicle]], [[setWaypointLoiterRadius]], [[waypointLoiterRadius]], [[addWaypoint]], [[setWaypointLoiterType]], [[waypointSpeed]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 27 Aug 2007
<dt class="note">[[User:Way|Way]]
<dd class="note">
(A1 1.08) Does not seem to work with Game Logic. Crashes to desktop.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 26 Nov 2008
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">
Note that a waypoints number as seen in the mission editor is not the same as it is waypoint number using this command. In the mission editor, waypoint 0 refers to the first placed waypoint, whereas waypoint 0 with the setCurrentWaypoint command refers to the unit's initial position waypoint.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 17 Jan 2010
<dt class="note">[[User:Galzohar|Galzohar]]
<dd class="note">
(A2 1.05) This command may crash the game to desktop if you call it from the on act field of a waypoint that belongs to that same unit. 

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 13 Aug 2012
<dt class="note">[[User:Igneous01|Igneous01]]
<dd class="note">
Using this command forces the last waypoint to complete. Any code in the on Act of that waypoint will run. 
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
